byline.docAuthor: Derek Pang, Huizhong Chen and Sherif Halawa

front.div:
Abstractâ€”In this report, we propose two wavelet video coding
schemes for the application of interactive region of interest (IRoI),
namely the temporal prediction plus 2-D transform (T+2D)
scheme and the 2-D transform plus in-band prediction (2D+T)
scheme. The schemes provide a solution to the RoI cropping
problem in the compressed domain as encountered in the current
IRoI technique, which divides the video frame into slices and
encode them separately using the H.264. We have modified the
standard EBCOT and zero-tree entropy coder for compressing
wavelet RoI residuals. Comparing with the H.264 slice-based RoI
video coding technique, experimental results have shown our
proposed schemes can provide up to 2 dB PSNR gain in RoI
video coding.
